author: Michelle Hackman
title: Fewer Suspensions, More ‘Hugs and Bubbles’: Oklahoma City’s Experiment in School Discipline
text:
OKLAHOMA CITY—Amanda Rhodes, a first-grade teacher at Edwards Elementary School on this city’s predominantly black northeast side, keeps an app on her touch-screen whiteboard with avatars of each student. With a tap, she awards points to students who follow directions. One recent Thursday, the students had racked up so many points that their teacher paused her lesson for a dance break.
Across this sprawling urban school district, teachers and administrators are overseeing a controversial experiment to promote positive behaviors...
